p: Brachial plexus avulsion (BPA) is a common clinical circumstance in small animal practice. BPA can be associated with neuropathic pain affecting the quality of life (QoL) of human patients. The aim of the study was to describe the clinical and electrodiagnostic (EDX) findings and the outcome of a cohort of dogs and cats with BPA and to investigate their QoL, the presence of signs of pain and the ownersâ€™ perspective.
